landing.splashSubtitle: Hi! I'm Manuel Ceppi, a Back end Developer from Rimini, Italy. I'm currently working at Spiagge.it, a SaaS startup company that helps beach resorts to manage and automate their business. Below, you can find some of my experiences.
landing.aboutMeText: Hello! My name is Manuel, and i'm a Back end Developer from Rimini, Italy. I'm a passionate developer, always eager to learn new things. I also like markets and reading about finance and investing. I love mangas, animes and my beaufitul black & white cat, Coco. In my free time i like to play the piano, read books, train and ride my motorbike.
landing.experiencesText: My software development career started in 2018, when i joined Wedo s.r.l as a Junior Developer. I worked on a wide range of projects with different technologies, from desktop erps in C# to Cloud applications with .Net Core and Angular (2). Then on 2022 i totally changed my stack, in fact i now work on a PHP environment with Laravel. Below, you can find more details about all the stack which i worked with.
landing.wedoText: At wedo, i mainly worked as a consultant for different IT businesses in different projects; Different projects also means different technologies and stacks:I've put myself in mobile android native development, web development and desktop development; Furthermore, this kind of experience taught to me how to work in several teams with different people. You can find all the projects in detail in my resume.
landing.fortechText: After leaving IT consultancy, i wanted join a product based IT business. In Fortech, i had the opportunity to work in a project for the biggest petrol company in italy, Eni. The project was called NonOilManager, and basically was a cash desk and warehouse management web application, built with Angular and .Net core. I was a full stack in this project, so i've worked with both the technologies.
landing.spiaggeText: In August 2022, I had the opportunity to have my first experience in a Startup company, so I joined Spiagge.it. I was super excited about this new chapter in my life! Here, i completely changed my tech stack: i've started as a back end developer with laravel, so i had to learn a new language (PHP) and a new framework; I finally started to work with Docker and have a deeper look to infrastructures and all the AWS services that are concerned (CloudWatch, S3, RDS, EC2, ecc); I really had to push my self beyond my limits! I also started to follow more seriously the Agile (SCRUM) framework, with its different ceremonies and interaction with the Product Team and all the other departments. I also have the opportunity to work with some of the most skilled people that i've ever met in my life. Startup experiences really are something else!
landing.contactMeText: Feel free to press it if you want to get in touch with me!
